cue.label: Hook
cue.voice: Korporus is a federated application platform built around a shell host and runtime-loaded remotes.
Apps ship independently, then compose live through manifests and Web Component slot contracts.

cue.label: Federation Runtime
cue.voice: The host reads manifests, imports remote bootstrap modules, and mounts titlebar, main, and settings slots.
This keeps host and app delivery decoupled while preserving a stable integration boundary.

cue.label: Contract First
cue.voice: Korporus validates app manifests before loading and keeps integration explicit through named slot elements.
The same app remote can run in the shell and in external React or Angular host demos.

cue.label: Deployment Model
cue.voice: Hosts can be shipped as static frontends while remote runtimes and media infrastructure evolve independently.
That separation makes releases faster and reduces cross-team coupling.

cue.label: Get Started
cue.voice: Korporus brings runtime composition, explicit contracts, and framework-agnostic app embedding into one platform.
Explore the docs to build your first app.
